title: Unsupervised Deep Denoising of Four-Dimensional Scanning Transmission Electron Microscopy
content: Four-dimensional scanning transmission electron microscopy (4D STEM) offers new insights into the atomic structure of materials [1]. Despite its potential, the application of 4D STEM is limited when examining dose-sensitive materials [2]: reducing the electron dose to prevent specimen damage also reduces the signal-to-noise in the acquired data, thus complicating the analysis. To minimize sample exposure while maintaining sufficient data quality for reliable analysis, this study utilizes unsupervised deep learning to denoise 4D STEM datasets.
